description.narrative: The Project will achieve strong development impact and demonstrate IFC''s commitment to support financial inclusion and the development of frontier regions in China: (i) Improve Access to Financial Services: lack of access to financial services in rural areas and frontier regions has been a challenge for China. By using mobile networks effectively, access to financial services will no longer be limited to areas in which a bank is physically present or there is access to the Internet. Through easier access to the financial services visa mobile devices, underserved population will experience higher financial efficiency and capture more business opportunities, leading to increased income and improved livelihood. (ii) Promote Financial Sector Innovation: access to banking and payments services through the mobile phone is new in China. By assisting the pioneering mobile banking service provider at this important stage and by helping develop it into a model company, IFC is expected to have demonstrative impacts and accelerate adoption. (iii) Enhance Institution Building: through F-Road, IFC could potentially improve the operating efficiency, scale and financial transparency of small financial institutions and enable these financial institutions to reach out to their clients.

The proposed project will likely consist of IFCs equity investment of up to RMB50 million (US$8 million equivalent) in Shanghai F-Road Commercial Service Co., Ltd. (F-Road or the Company). F-Road, founded in Shanghai in 2008, is a financial service provider specialized in providing financial access to customers of small financial institutions through mobile devices. The project represents an opportunity for IFC to support a leading mobile banking service provider in China which serves a large number of rural population and micro-business sector through partnering with small financial institutions, with high potential of scaling up its outreach and impacts in rural and frontier regions. By using mobile devices, the underserved rural population and micro businesses would be able to access basic banking services including money transfer, remittance, bill payment, card operations, lending, account inquiry, account management, and cash-in/out through mobile payment platform established by F-Road.

participating-org.narrative: Shanghai F-Road Commercial Service Co., Ltd.

name.narrative: F-Road is headquartered in Shanghai, China and has a technology center in Zhuhai, Guangdong Province. It provides mobile banking services to financial institutions throughout the country.
